meanings.sent1: She had to updraw the heavy curtain to let more light in.
meanings.sent2: He used a rope to updraw the bucket from the well.
meanings.sent3: Trying to updraw a smile from the grumpy cat proved to be a challenge.
meanings.sent4: The sun seemed to updraw the colors of the sky as it set.
meanings.sent5: The magician's wand could updraw objects into the air with a flick.

meanings.definition: To sketch or outline in an upward direction.
meanings.sent1: The artist decided to updraw the mountains in the background of the painting.
meanings.sent2: She carefully updrew the staircase leading to the castle.
meanings.sent3: The child's attempt to updraw a rocket ship on the wall ended up looking like a banana.
meanings.sent4: Her imagination could updraw the most fantastical creatures on paper.
meanings.sent5: The pencil seemed to updraw a story of its own as it moved across the page.
